Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is being rushed through parliament, which is dangerous and reckless.
The idea of bureaucrats determining what is true is considered crazy and a threat to free speech.
There is a concern about censorship of professionals and dissenters, citing examples like Nigel Farage.
The bill is seen as an extension of government overreach and collusion with Big Tech during the pandemic.
Mainstream media (MSM) being exempt from the bill is problematic due to low trust in MSM.
The legislation is perceived as a step towards a police state and a threat to Australia's way of life.
Notable Quotes: To think that bureaucrats will be the arbitrators of what is TRUE is crazy!!
The censorship of well renowned professionals, who have proven to be right, is prolific, it has been sickening to watch the injustices occurring all over the world.
This bill is that on steroids.
It may sound alarming but we are slowly becoming a communist state, this bill would be speeding that up even more.
